Chappell, Simon P wrote:

> Yes, but even managers have heard of unit testing. I can see it now ....
> 
> PROGRAMMER: "Hey boss, I want to write some programmer tests."
> MANAGER: "Not on my watch. Now sit down and get back to your unit testing!"

PROGRAMMER: "Hey boss, if I told you I could go faster by biting the 
heads off live chickens, would you care as long as you didn't have to 
watch me do it and suffered no liability as a result?"

MANAGER: ?

> Funny you should mention that ... the good folks at 
> comp.software.testing have an FAQ that provides fairly decent 
> definitions for most of this stuff.
> 
> http://www.faqs.org/faqs/software-eng/testing-faq/
> 
> Whether management will accept this as a definitive source of 
> definitions is another question.

I sincerely hope it helps.
